title: How to Update Linux Packages With Yum

steps.title: Open the terminal.
steps.content: Open the terminal. You can do this by pressing Ctrl+Alt+T on your keyboard. Alternatively, you can press the super user (Windows) key on your keyboard to open the Activities menu and search for "terminal".

steps.title: Check for package updates (optional).
steps.content: Check for package updates (optional). If you prefer, you can check for any available package updates with the "check-update" subcommand. If you already know what packages you need to update or you just want to update them all, you can skip this step. In the terminal, write yum check-update and press Enter . All of the packages that yum can update will be listed.

steps.title: Run the update command for some or all of your packages.
steps.content: Run the update command for some or all of your packages. To do this, type yum update . Without any package names with it, the yum update command will try to update every package you have. [1] X Research source To specify a package (like the ones found in Step 3 with "check-update"), type its name after the yum update command. Once the packages are done updating, you can close out of the terminal.
